title: Highest prevalence of food insecurity
description: In 2022, 88.6% of Sierra Leone's population experienced moderate or severe food insecurity, one of the highest rates globally.

title: Lowest fixed telephone subscriptions
description: As of 2022, Sierra Leone had only 0.00325 fixed telephone subscriptions per 100 people, one of the lowest rates worldwide.

title: High gross intake ratio in primary education for females
description: In 2018, the gross intake ratio for females entering the first grade of primary education in Sierra Leone was 175.7%, indicating a high level of enrollment relative to the age group.

title: High diarrhea treatment coverage
description: In 2019, 85.3% of children under 5 in Sierra Leone received oral rehydration salts (ORS) for diarrhea treatment, reflecting strong healthcare intervention in this area.
